# Baleen Whales: Typically below 5 kHz
The following is a list of Mysticete species monitored by NEFSC Passive Acoustic Branch. Call types that are frequently used to detect specific acoustic events are listed under each specie. *This is not meant to be comprehensive of all marine mammal repertoire’s.* An acoustic event guide is linked for each specie. 



### [**Minke whale**](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1_ousoPs5N14lc2Q30PRiQJTqco7hJgHyV0UjiVki3t8/edit?usp=sharing)\
![](/figs/infographics/Minke_noaafisheries.png){width=30%}\
Scientific name: *Balaenoptera acutorostrata*  
Makara species code: MIWH \
**Call types**:\

* Minke whale pulse train  
  * Currently includes all pulse train types: constant/slow-down/speed-up  
  * Makara call-type code: MWPT


![](/figs/Spec_images/Baleen/MINKE_spec2.PNG){width=65%}
\
*Spectrogram image of Minke pulse train*

\
\

### [**Sei whale**](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fGzkwFc7h61blOXYh17bI_d8doHLZGra2VNQUWdKve4/edit?usp=sharing)\
![](/figs/infographics/Sei_noafisheries.png){width=40%}

Scientific name: *Balaenoptera borealis*  
Makara species code: SEWH \
**Call types**:\

* Sei whale 30-80 Hz downsweep  
  * Sei whale downsweep spanning 80-30Hz, occurs as single downsweeps or repeated 3 \- 5 seconds apart as doublets, triplets, or more. If different distinguishable downsweep types are used, please notify PACM group to add call type  
  * Makara call-type code: SWDS


![](/figs/Spec_images/Baleen/SEI_spec2.PNG){width=65%}
\
*Spectrogram image of Sei Whale downsweep*

\
\

### [**Blue whale**](https://docs.google.com/document/d/19L__V_lix58h0AdbCwDYEX1Zc5QUiXz188UpWR1zI3s/edit?usp=sharing)\
![](/figs/infographics/Blue_noaafisheries.jpg){width=50%}

Scientific name: *Balaenoptera musculus*  
Makara species code: BLWH\
**Call types**:\

* Blue whale A/B/AB song  
  * North Atlantic blue whale song: includes all three call types (A, B, and AB)  
  * Makara call-type code: BLSONG  
* Blue whale Arch/D call  
  * North Atlantic blue whale Arch calls, or D calls  
  * Makara call-type code: BLARCH
* Blue whale mix calls  
  * North Atlantic blue whale mix of calls including A/B/AB song, Arch calls, and D calls  
  * Makara call-type code: BLMIX


![](/figs/Spec_images/Baleen/BLUE_spec2.PNG){width=65%}
\
*Spectrogram image of Blue whale A/B/AB song*

\
\

### [**Fin whale**](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1bXCzrTeI0NdcED77ta8NU3jDPV2ocm93PBAVfs3ST9Y/edit?usp=sharing)\
![](/figs/infographics/fin_noaafisheries.jpg){width=40%}

Scientific name: *Balaenoptera physalus*  
Makara species code: FIWH \
**Call types**:\

* Fin whale 130-Hz note  
  * Fin whale 130-Hz note  
  * Makara call-type code: FWNOTE  
* Fin whale 20-Hz pulse  
  * Fin whale 20-Hz pulses (song and non-song)  
  * Makara call-type code: FWPLS
* Fin whale downsweep/ 40-Hz call  
  * Fin whale downsweep (termed “higher frequency sounds”, “HF downsweep”, or “40-Hz” call): spanning \~75-40 Hz  
  * Makara call-type code: FWDS  
* Fin whale mix calls  
  * Mix off North Atlantic fin whale call types: 20-Hz calls, 130-Hz note, and the higher-frequency downsweeps (\~75-40 Hz), also referred to as “40-Hz” calls  
  * Makara call-type code: FWMIX


![](/figs/Spec_images/Baleen/FIN_spec2.PNG){width=65%}
\
*Spectrogram image of Fin whale 20-Hz pulse calls*

\
\

### [**North Atlantic right whale**](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1pG4Ex4f9clbsJ2uC93g5c3mZIuzRkcEE27GmtRs_820/edit?usp=sharing)\
![](/figs/infographics/NARW_noaafisheries.png){width=40%}

Scientific name: *Eubalaena glacialis*  
Makara species code: RIWH  \
**Call types**:\

* North Atlantic right whale gunshot  
  * Right whale gunshot: broadband signal  
  * Makara call-type code: NARWGUNSHOT  
* North Atlantic right whale moan  
  * Right whale moan: typically 100-200 Hz  
  * Makara call-type code: NARWMOAN  
* North Atlantic right whale upcall  
  * Contact-call produced by right whales: typically 100-300 Hz upsweep  
  * Makara call-type code: NARWUPCALL


![](/figs/Spec_images/Baleen/NARW_spec2.PNG){width=65%}
\
*Spectrogram image of North Atlantic Right Whale upcalls*

\
\

### [**Humpback whale**](https://docs.google.com/document/d/15Dt6aoZ1KMN3KAOQ2A4jmTa3C8to7kAvFHIf9smWTP4/edit?usp=sharing)\
![](/figs/infographics/Humpback_whale_Dawn.png){width=38%}

Scientific name: *Megaptera novaeangliae*  
Makara species code: HUWH\
**Call types**:\

* Humpback whale social  
  * Humpback whale social calls only  
  * Makara call-type code: HWSOC  
* Humpback whale song  
  * Humpback whale song only  
  * Makara call-type code: HWSONG  
* Humpback whale mixed call  
  * Humpback whale mixed song and social calls  
  * Makara call-type code: HWMIX

Humpback whale songs change frequently over the years. See below for audio/spectrogram examples of North Atlantic Humpback songs collected by NEFSC PAB between 2008 - 2021.
